A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I know many people disagree and that's fine. We need to accept that people won't always like what we like or enjoy what we enjoy. And that's actually a great thing in many ways because we get to see it from a different perspective! However\, I cannot agree with people who say The Last Jedi wasn't good\, because man\, oh man\, was it.  I was blown away and I adored every second of it.  I went in prepared to love Kylo Ren and the whole cast for being who they are and I wasn't disappointed at all. \n\nI heard some say that there wasn't a lot of character development\, but I beg to differ. Rey sheds the personal of a naive young girl from Jakku who just wants her parents\, to be a woman who realizes she is a Jedi and can help shape the world.  I don't want to go into too much detail\, because spoilers\, but here's hoping you give it a chance.
